definition: to take on titles, offices, duties, or responsibilities
details:
verb
- to take on titles, offices, duties, or responsibilities
= example: to take on titles, offices, duties, or responsibilities
= synonyms: adopt, take on, take over
- to take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect
= example: to take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect
= synonyms: take
- to take to be the case or to be true
= example: to take to be the case or to be true
= synonyms: presume
- to take up someone's soul into heaven
= example: to take up someone's soul into heaven
- to make a pretence of
= example: to make a pretence of
= synonyms: sham
- to occupy or take on
= example: to occupy or take on
= synonyms: strike
- to seize and take control without authority and possibly with force
= example: to seize and take control without authority and possibly with force
= synonyms: seize, take over, usurp, arrogate
